steps.name: Given that the Entando Operator is running in 'community' compliance mode
And the Operator runs in a Kubernetes environment the requires a filesystem user/group override for mounted volumes
When I request an DBMS Capability with no additional parameters
Executing command PROVIDE_CAPABILITY
Executing command PROCESS_DEPLOYABLE
Then an EntandoDatabaseService was provisioned:
using the DeployDirectly provisioningStrategy
a PostgreSQL database
and it is owned by the ProvidedCapability to ensure only changes from the ProvidedCapability will change the implementing Kubernetes resources
And a Kubernetes Deployment was created reflecting the requirements of the PostgreSQL image:centos/postgresql-12-centos7
using the PostgreSQL Image centos/postgresql-12-centos7
With a volume mounted to the standard data directory /var/lib/pgsql/data
Which is bound to a PersistentVolumeClain
And livenessProbe, startupProbe and readinessProbe all use the standard PostgreSQL command /usr/libexec/check-container
And the File System User/Group override 26has been applied to the mount
And has admin credentials resolved from a dynamically provisioned admin secret
And the admin secret specifies the standard super user 'postgres' as user and has a dynamically generated password
And a Kubernetes Service was created:

labels.value: As a controller developer, I would like request a DBMS Capability to be deployed on demand so that I don't need to concern myself with the details o deploying a DBMS server
